entry.title: Ukraine Claims Heavy Russian Losses in South
entry.content: Kyiv’s military said it struck near Berdyansk, while the Ukrainian mayor of Russian-occupied Melitopol reported a large, unexplained explosion there.

entry.title: Paris Shooting Kills at Least Three, With Kurdish Center Among Sites Hit
entry.content: The attack in the heart of the French capital left at least three others injured, officials said. Police detained a suspect.

entry.title: Putin, Isolated and Distrustful, Leans on Handful of Hard-Line Advisers
entry.content: Russia’s president built a power structure designed to deliver him the information he wants to hear, feeding into his miscalculations on the Ukraine war.

entry.title: Russia Threatens to Cut Oil Output By Up to 7%
entry.content: Moscow comments over reducing production by up to 7%, or 700,000 barrels a day, boosts global crude prices

entry.title: France and U.K. Face Wave of Strikes During Holiday Season
entry.content: The U.K. and France braced for disruptions to holiday travel, as British border-control personnel went on strike and French rail workers walked off the job.
